items.title: Live: PM and premiers to discuss hospital funding following national cabinet meeting
items.description: Anthony Albanese and state premiers will address the media after a national cabinet meeting to discuss hospital funding. Follow live.

items.title: Australia taking Nipah virus seriously but no changes to border control
items.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

items.title: 35 GPS devices were planted in e-waste in Australia. Where are they now?
items.description: A not-for-profit environmental group put GPS devices in 35 e-waste items and dropped them off at recycling locations in four Australian capital cities. Here's what they found.

items.title: The armed groups that may risk the US 'recovery' plan to control Venezuela
items.description: The US plan to "recover" Venezuela could spark a domestic backlash in a country that is already heavily divided among various armed groups that have political interests.

items.title: Breaking: Ley issues ultimatum to Littleproud, as she announces temporary shadow ministry
items.description: The under-fire Liberal leader has given seven existing frontbenchers carriage of the portfolios vacated by Nationals, with a threat to leader David Littleproud the arrangements could be made permanent.

items.title: Trump threatens fresh tariffs on 10 countries in almost as many days
items.description: Since the beginning of the year, US President Donald Trump has threatened tariffs against at least 10 countries. Some experts say the Trump administration's tariff policy is leading to the creation of new trading blocs, and isolating the United States.

items.title: Two aspirants unlikely to suit the times vie for Liberal leadership
items.description: Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor both want to run against Sussan Ley. But the two right-wingers cannot afford to split the conservative vote on which their tilts would rely.

items.title: Body of 16-year-old bushwalker found in Blue Mountains creek
items.description: Police say the teen and his 17-year-old friend became separated after setting out on a three-day hike.

items.title: Live: Gadecki and Peers' in mixed doubles final before Alcaraz, Zverev kick off men's semis
items.description: Australia's Olivia Gadecki and John Peers try for a second straight mixed doubles final win on day 13 at the Australian Open, before the men's semifinals begin with Carlos Alcaraz and Alexander Zverev. Follow live.

items.title: Landlord to stand trial for alleged cold case murder of his tenant
items.description: A landlord has been ordered to stand trial over the cold case death of his tenant Christopher Jarvis, who disappeared from his home near Warrnambool 20 years ago.

items.title: 'It's going to damage a lot of people': Former AIS athletes demand Channel 9 pull documentary
items.description: Former AIS athletes who claim they were physically and psychologically abused while living at the AIS have urged Channel Nine to shutter a documentary about the history of the institute.

items.title: The US looks poised to strike Iran — but what is Trump's endgame?
items.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

items.title: A rate hike on Tuesday will be a 'bitter pill' for middle Australia
items.description: Consumer advocates fear a rate hike when the RBA board meets next week could be the "straw that breaks the camel's back" for borrowers in mortgage stress.

items.title: Singapore without an opposition leader after PM deposes him
items.description: Even for a de facto one-party state, the ruling People's Action Party's decision to dictate who runs Singapore's opposition is remarkable.

items.title: In a city largely insulated from political violence, the unthinkable happened
items.description: As the Invasion Day rally incident and Bondi terror attack shatter expectations that people should be able to gather peacefully in public places, Australians may be facing a new normal.

items.title: It has been backed by Trump and Rinehart — but where is the Arafura mine?
items.description: It is the Central Australian mine promised to help upset China's dominance of the rare earths market worldwide, and bring hundreds of jobs to Australia. But where is it?

items.title: The most popular Aussie movie in 2025 starred joeys. It's up for six awards
items.description: Ahead of next week's AACTA Awards, the makers of frontrunners Bring Her Back, Kangaroo and Apple Cider Vinegar share their thoughts on the state of the local screen industry.

items.title: String bags and no plastic: How grocery shopping used to be
items.description: A New South Wales grocery store has been operating since before there was refrigeration, electricity and even Vegemite.

items.title: 'Huge constitutional issue': NSW committee backs ban on chanting contested phrase
items.description: An inquiry will advise the NSW government to consider banning the phrase "globalise the intifada", despite most public submissions opposing the move and warnings that it may be unconstitutional.

items.title: Live: ASX up, Nine sells radio arm
items.description: Nine Entertainment has sold its radio division to the Laundy family, while buying outdoor ad company QMS.  The ASX is up slightly in morning trade. Follow live.

items.title: 'We can do better': Trump's tsar promises 'safer' Minnesota operation
items.description: Tom Homan says he is working on a plan to pull federal agents out of Minnesota as part of a major strategy shift — but it might not be enough to prevent another US government shutdown

items.title: Extreme heatwave warning as NSW hits 40+ degrees for sixth day
items.description: As parts of western and south-western New South Wales enter their sixth day of temperatures above 40 degrees, authorities are urging people not to become complacent.

items.title: In following his own theory, man finds human remains that could be Celine Cremer’s
items.description: Celine Cremer went missing in 2023 from a track in a remote part of Tasmania's north-west. With several recent discoveries in the area, these are the theories of what could have happened.

items.title: Inpex investigated after suspected sulphur dioxide exposure hospitalises worker
items.description: The Australian Workers' Union has raised concerns after a worker at Inpex's Ichthys gas facility was allegedly exposed to sulphur dioxide and hospitalised, prompting an investigation by the NT workplace safety watchdog.

items.title: Why Lachie Neale is having his 'best pre-season in a long time' despite drama
items.description: Lachie Neale has been in the spotlight all summer after giving up the Brisbane co-captaincy amid his highly-publicised marriage breakdown but the Lions brass believe the premiership winner is physically in the midst of his best pre-season in some years.
